raw_text:
Tarantino to direct CSI episode
 
 Film director Quentin Tarantino is to direct an episode of US television series CSI: Crime Scene Investigation.
 
 The Oscar-winning Pulp Fiction director has also written an original story for the season finale episode. CSI's co-producer, Carol Mendelsohn, said the episode would have "more bugs and blood" than usual. It is not Tarantino's first venture into TV. In 1995 he directed an episode of the medical drama ER and has also appeared in Alias.
 
 Ms Mendelsohn said the production team had been trying for a while to get Tarantino to direct an episode of CSI, and added that he was a fan of the forensic drama. She said he finally agreed a few weeks ago while CSI was doing some location shooting in Las Vegas and the show's stars persuaded him. "He knows everything there is to know about CSI, and he is into the whole mythology of CSI," Mendelsohn said. "Quentin came in a couple of weeks ago. We had a story meeting with the writers. "He had a great idea, and it was so much fun to have him in the room... we are positively giddy." Filming is due to start in early April and the Tarantino-directed episode will be broadcast in the US on 19 May.

The production team has been trying to secure him for months, and he is a fan of the show. Filming is set to start in April, and the episode is expected to be broadcast on May 19.

He wrote an original story for the season finale and is not new to TV directing; he previously directed an ER episode. The production team had been trying to get him for years. Tarantino was persuaded by the show's stars to participate in the project. Filming started in early April, with the episode airing on May 19th in the US.

tinyllama:1.1b: Film director Quentin Tarantino will direct an episode of popular TV series CSICOP (Crime Scene Investigation) in a season finale titled "The Infernal Machine". The show's co-producer Carol Mendelsohn disclosed that the episode would have more bugs and blood than usual, as Tarantin's first venture into TV was an Episode of ER which he appeared in in 1995. Tarantin's love for the franchise and his overall knowledge about CSICOP led him to agree to direct the Tarantin-written episode. The episode will be broadcast in the US on 19 May, and filming is set to start soon in Las Vegas.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Tarantino has been tapped by CSI creator Steven Spielberg to direct an episode of the crime drama series, which aired on CBS from 2004-2015. The show is known for its gripping storylines and high-quality production values, making it an ideal fit for Tarantino's cinematic style. Additionally, the episode will have more bugs and blood than usual, which will be exciting for fans of the show.

Produced by Carol Mendelsohn, CSI: Crime Scene Investigation's co-producer, the episode is set to premiere on April 19th and will likely air in early May. Tarantino has a history of directing episodes of television series, including an episode of ER back in 1995. Despite having directed multiple episodes of his own film, "Pulp Fiction," Tarantino is not a stranger to the world of TV, having appeared on Alias as well.

Fans of Tarantino's work should be excited for what this project may bring to the table, and we can expect a thrilling episode of CSI: Crime Scene Investigation with more gore and detail than ever before.
